However, 100 days into the invasion, it's clear that those sanctions are doing little to dissuade/disable the Russian state from prosecuting its war. Simultaneously, there are widely publicised cases of prominent Australian companies reluctant to cease business with Russia, with many more likely continuing to operate there in obscurity.

All that despite that any company offering their products or services in Russia both contributes to the Russian economy and, by extension, to the war, and lends legitimacy to Russia's actions, including war crimes.

We believe that the only meaningful way to upgrade the sanctions regimes from nominal to effective is an imposition of a total embargo. Australia has previously demonstrated its resolve and world leadership in comparable scenarios (e.g. tobacco advertising ban), and we believe that the gravity of the situation in Ukraine calls for nothing less.
We therefore ask the House to prevent Australian companies and individuals from obtaining or supplying goods or services, investing, or otherwise Russian Federation-based entities.
from eight citizens (Petition No. EN4276)
Nuclear Energy
Australia has over 30% of the worlds uranium and yet we do not use it to our advantage. It's time we reconsider our rules and regulations regarding nuclear power in Australia.
We therefore ask the House to consider the ever-growing possibility of nuclear power in Australia.
from 19 citizens (Petition No. EN4278)
Ukraine
Ukraine's Minister of Foreign Affairs, Dmytro Kuleba has requested additional heavy weapons and support from Australia's Minister of Foreign Affairs, Penny Wong.

Ukrainians are willing to defend themselves and the Ukrainian army is proving to the world that they are a strong and capable force. But the Ukrainian army is outnumbered and cannot hold the Russian forces off in an extended war of attrition. Ukraine requires air defence missiles and anti-tank weapons. We understand that Australia is working with NATO and providing support to fund the supply of these weapons. This is an excellent step forward,
but more funds and support are urgently needed.
We therefore ask the House to review the number of available:
Armoured vehicles
M777 howitzers
Short and medium range missile systems
Unmanned aerial vehicles
Artillery
Infantry weapons
which are in use within Australian sectors and work with our defence forces to provide more of this equipment to Ukraine.

Ukrainian forces are well trained and are cognisant in the use of various military equipment. This has been proven over the past three months. There is fully functional equipment which Australia is planning to retire or sell, which can be utilised in Ukraine to save lives.
Existing equipment which Australia provides to Ukraine can be replenished with newly manufactured, or superseding systems, which will create further jobs within Australia.
from 39 citizens (Petition No. EN4279)
Ukraine
Ukraine's economy is on course to contract by almost half this year as the Russian invasion and the impact of a "deep humanitarian crisis" takes its toll, the World Bank has said.
With a blockade of Black Sea ports in the south of Ukraine and the havoc caused to industry in the east, the war-torn country's GDP is projected to shrink by about 45% in 2022.
We therefore ask the House to include Ukraine into Australian Generalized System of Tariff Preferences as soon as possible, to bolster Ukraine's economy.
from 31 citizens (Petition No. EN4280)

subdebateinfo.title: Pensions and Benefits: Veterans and Emergency Services Personnel

p.span: Pensions and Benefits: Veterans and Emergency Services Personnel

This petition is to award veterans and emergency service personnel for their exemplary service for country and state. Little recognition is given to their valuable service by any past government, accept a thank you letter from previous, for putting lives on the line to protect and serve this great country. Many military, Fire fighters, Ambulance, SES and Police have served the people well and kept this country safe and many have sustained medical conditions and mental health issues from their valuable service. They have volunteered to serve they country and faced great odds in their service life as well as their civilian life and believe they should be dually recognised for arduous life that they have given freely to Australia.

We therefore ask the House to consider and urge the Government of Australia to bring forward the age of retirement and age pension for Veterans and Emergency Service personnel that have served a minimum of four years full time or have be active overseas on a engagement to be reduced to the age of 60 years of age with full entitlements.
from four citizens (Petition No. EN4281)
Skilled Migration Program

Hawkesbury and Blue Mountains Council are the only parts in Sydney Metropolitan area for 491 visa holders to live. Hawkesbury is classified as Metro everywhere and only for 491 Regional visas it is classified as Regional. Kindly please cancel Windsor and Richmond in New South Wales from designated regional area postcodes.

Nowadays many people are coming to Windsor and Richmond in NSW as it is closer to Sydney City and has the train line. This is causing huge rental shortages , high unemployment , high traffic congestion in the hawkesbury area. 491 visa is designated for development of regional areas but adding only Hawkesbury in Sydney causes trouble to Western Sydney.
So kindly reclassify Windsor and Richmond in NSW as metro parts and take it away from 491 regional visa area.
We therefore ask the House to Remove Hawkesbury from 491 visa Regional Area.
from three citizens (Petition No. EN4282)
Housing

Australia is suffering from an unprecedented lack of rental accommodation throughout the country. In the 2016 ABS census more than one million homes were unoccupied at census time. Some would be for recently deceased, sick in hospital, people on holidays, awaiting sale or rental, but many will have been extra homes not needed by normal families at the time of the census.

We therefore ask the House to determine which homes are unoccupied and utilise them for those suffering from homelessness, poverty and general malaise from lack of rental properties. The ABS will have a list of those unoccupied dwellings from the 2021 census. The owner should not lose ownership of the property but gain fair rental at 25% of the renters income.
from seven citizens (Petition No. EN4283)
Mental Health
There is a need for PTSD counselling for generational PTSD, for the defence force and frontline workers' children.
While Open Arms is available, their understanding of what children suffer and how they suffer is a time lost on them.
A dedicated counselling service would go a long way in helping children to reach out for help.
What we experience compared to our parents is misunderstood by the wider community.
We therefore ask the House to o look into and understand that there is a difference between PTSD and generational PTSD.
There are people out there with complex issues due to generational PTSD.

I am 58 and suffer from my father's service in Vietnam and the mental health of others in the same situation is an issue needing to looked at, as people my age and younger, commit suicide to stop their suffering.
from four citizens (Petition No. EN4294)
Gender Dysphoria

Hi I'm making this petetion as its pride month and wanting to make a change for trans and non-binary people who are currently suffering at the hands of gender dysphoria.The LGBTQIA community has been suffering for years with the hate , harassment, death threats , brashing , flag burning.Too many LGBTQI+ kids and adults have and are suffering right now as access to affordable gender affirming surgeries are limited. This has lead them to attempt to, or succeed in ending their life.LGBTQIA+ people have the highest rates of both suicidal thoughts and suicide attempts in Australia. Supporting children , young adults and adults transition into a person they feel comfortable with and want to be should be funded by Medicare. support and funding there top surgery and bottom surgery would let other people be comfortable and some may find a reason to fight for there rights and be who they always want to be .
We therefore ask the House to make change to medicare so top and bottom surgery can be funded
from 11 citizens (Petition No. EN4296)
Economy

With the global and local issues affecting the Australian economy and impacting on cost of living there is significant concern that many companies and individuals are engaging in price gouging due to availability and limited supply of some goods and services. The cost of some goods and services is being artificially increased through price gouging activities which are significantly impacting the cost of living for all Australians. Price gouging occurs when a seller increases the prices of goods, services, or commodities to a level much higher than is considered reasonable or fair.
We therefore ask the House to enact, update and strengthen legalisation to pursue and penalise companies and individuals who engage in price gouging activities.
from 10 citizens (Petition No. EN4297)
Health Care

With the global and local issues affecting the Australian economy and impacting the lives of all Australians, attention is drawn to the perceived shortage of doctors, medical staff, hospital beds and after-hours doctors. This shortage is very apparent when ambulances are forced to wait hours at hospital ranks to unload patients. The media has also reported a number of deaths hat have potentially been linked to these perceived shortages. Whilst it is recognised that the State governments have jurisdiction over the manner in which health funds are spent, it is essential that the federal government focus it's health funding to drive the state governments to address these perceived shortages and improve the health of ordinary Australians.

We therefore ask the House to do all in its power to ensure health funding provided to the state governments is spent in a manner that addresses the real needs of all Australians and that it provides fair and equal access to medical facilities and resources across Australia. We also ask that the federal government introduce legislation that holds the state governments accountable for reducing these perceived shortages in medical facilities and resources.
from nine citizens (Petition No. EN4298)
Energy

When electricity prices rise they give the reason that cost of supplying it increases. The cost of households and business to supply a solar feed in also rises as the cost to be connected to the grid has gone up. It stands to reason that if a KW of electricity has a value attached to it eg. 24c/kwh then it should also calculated using similar formula for every kwh being fed back to the grid, therefore if the price of electricity rises the so should feed in tariffs.

We therefore ask the House to pass a law that requires all electricity providers to supply a feed in tariff of a fair rate and require that rate to rise in line with current and future electricity price rises.
from 20 citizens (Petition No. EN4301)
Migration

489 visa holders have already spent ~1,000 days (~1 year to get 489 visa and 2 years stay in regional area) to be eligible for 887 visa, however, even after being neglected during testing times of COVID, we kept going and contributed to Australia's economic recovery with limited job opportunities while being completely excluded from any form of assistance (job keeper/job seeker).

The key issues facing us include a) Instability due to uncertainty, b) Lack of job opportunities—very few employers want to hire bridging visa holders because of lack of certainty around future, c) Kids still unsettled—887 visa applicants who have kids nearing University age must pay for international student fees, which in many cases can't be afforded. It ends up wasting crucial productive years of kids who could start their university education without being held back as a result of 25 months of processing time of 887 visa and d) Can't settle in Australia and plan ahead—887 visa applicants are treated as foreigners and therefore, unable to buy a house without FIRB approval and significant cost of stamp duty of 11-12% and FIRB approval cost (~$6.5k).

We therefore ask the House to request the Government to show MERCY and allow 887 visa applicants to come out of uncertainty by kindly allocating more Case Officers (currently <1) to clear the backlog of onshore 887 visa applications (~20,000 pending) at par with resources allocated to process 190, 189, 491 visa applications. Many thanks!
from four citizens (Petition No. EN4306)
Assange, Mr Julian Paul

Stop the extradition of Julian Assange from the UK to the US. We need the Australian Gov to step up and represent Julian Assange, an Australia citizen, and put a stop to his wrongful imprisonment. "Enough is enough!", as quoted by the current Australian Prime Minister, Anthony Albanese.

We therefore ask the House to demand that the government of the United Kingdom immediately cease any further action in the extradition of Julian Assange from the United Kingdom to the United States of America and demand that Julian Assange, an Australian citizen be returned to Australia.
from 49 citizens (Petition No. EN4310)
Telecommunications: Social Media

Teenage girls are in an epidemic mental health war of isolation if your not on social media and involved in face and body augmentation leading to eating and mental health sickness if you are on it, with bullying online that never can be unwritten. Not to mention the huge Medicare cancer bills for toxic face filler use from the age of 13 to 25/30.

We therefore ask the House to draft legislation to make all social media illegal for under 18s. Spot fines of $1000 for first offences and )3000 for second offences and $10,000 for third offences with a police record.
from five citizens (Petition No. EN4314)
Migration: Bangladesh

Number of grant VISA for Bangladeshi students dropped significantly due to consulate service removed from Australian High Commission in Bangladesh to Australian High Commission in New Delhi. A big number of potential visa applications for applicant in Bangladesh are rejected or unsuccessful since consular service managed by the Australian Department of Home Affairs, at the Australian High Commission in New Delhi.

In all aspect Bangladeshi students are highly qualified if we compare them with other country's student who getting VISA to study in Australia. In 2020 Bangladeshi students does not get even 1% of total VISA, where 38.4 per cent (160,430) were from China, and 19.0 per cent (79,410) were from India, with the remaining top ten nationalities being Nepal 8,2% (34149), Vietnam 3,7%, Malaysia 2.7%, Pakistan 2,5%, Indonesia 2.5%, Sri Lanka 2.4%, Hong Kong 2.2%, and Singapore 1.6%.

Bangladesh is fast growing economy. A big number of students are academically and financially eligible to study abroad. They are very gentle and well behave discipline youth. They are getting a significant number of Student visa from Europe and North America. Unfortunately, when they try for Australia almost all of visa application are unsuccessful or rejected. That is why Bangladeshi origin Australian citizens are considering this mater as a discrimination which is led by racism by local consulate staff who involved in VISA processing procedure.
We therefore ask the House to restore consulate service in Australian High Commission in Bangladesh as before.
from two citizens (Petition No. EN4315)
Housing: Building Standards

Installing internal networking not connecting to external networks is priced well beyond the reach of the average home owner. With the prevalence of internet connected appliances, home owners should be able to install their own data cable.

We therefore ask the House to debate the ability for home owners to perform their own install of data cable for their own internal computer networks. The ACMA regulations need to be updated for the current day.
from five citizens (Petition No. EN4318)
Human Rights: China

People from the Turkic ethnic groups in Northwest China including Uyghurs, Kazakhs, Uzbek and Tatars are currently the target of the largest organized detention of an ethno-religious community the world has seen since World War II. Since 2017, more than one million people have been rounded up and put into 1,200 internment camps across East Turkistan (Xinjiang). Hundreds of thousands are enslaved for the benefit of major international brands in the factories around those camps.
Forced labour conditions include:
o restrictions on the movement of labourers,
o debt bondage,
o constant digital surveillance,
o forced isolation,
o forced sterilization,
o abusive working conditions, and
o the withholding of wages.
People detained are forcibly pushed to do low-skilled, labour-intensive work across the textile, garment, and automotive sectors.
The Australian Government has taken steps to address China's human rights violations In East Turkistan (Xinjiang) in recent years. However, its action is much behind than other democratic countries.

Australia must take a strong stand against the well documented abuse of millions of Uyghur people in Xinjiang. It would be a human rights disgrace if Australia, under our free trade agreement with China, turned a blind eye to profiteering from what amounts to slave labour.

We therefore ask the House to call on the Australian Government to fulfil its pre-election promises to address issues of Uyghur forced labour by passing the Customs Amendment (Banning Goods Produced By Uyghur Forced Labour) Bill 2021.
from five citizens (Petition No. EN4321)
National Disability Insurance Scheme

The NDIS changes in pricing arrangements set to take effect on the 1st of July have removed Play Therapy from the list of approved supports. This will affect the jobs of hundreds of Australians practicing as Play Therapists and thousands of children and young people currently receiving Play Therapy support through the funding. Play Therapy is an evidence-based, theoretically grounded, non-threatening and developmentally appropriate therapeutic intervention. It is suitable for children both above and below the age of seven, where limitations of verbal expression can be overcome through harnessing the natural language of childhood: play. Meta-analyses of over 200 studies on Play Therapy have shown it is effective in the treatment of most childhood presentations, including but not limited to Autism Spectrum Disorder, Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder, speech issues, social issues, emotional regulation issues, attachment disorders, impulsivity, anxiety, depression, toileting issues, phobias, sensory regulation issues, and trauma.

We therefore ask the House to reinstate Play Therapy on the list of NDIS funded therapeutic supports. Particularly, in alignment with the current changes upholding professional membership and high levels of training, we ask that the House advocate that Master Level (AQF Level 9) qualified Play Therapists registered with the Australasia Pacific Play Therapy Association be included in the updated list, as equal to other Master qualified Art and Music Therapists (who are already included). This will see the ongoing access to this effective and developmentally appropriate treatment for thousands of vulnerable young Australians.
from seven citizens (Petition No. EN4324)
Brisbane: Infrastructure

Failed planning to address the infrastructure needs of Brisbane's growing Western suburbs together with recent rainfall and flooding events highlighted insufficient transport and flood resilient infrastructure resulting in isolated communities, no access to essential goods and restricted access to emergency/medical services.

Once flooded roads opened but river access points were still closed as Wivenhoe dam was still releasing it created traffic gridlock and long peak hour commute times. With one main road in and out of the region catering to the 21,000 residents of Moggill/Bellbowrie/Anstead/Karana Downs/Mt Crosby/Pullenvale it has now become a matter of safety during flood/fire for the safe evacuation of residents west of Kenmore in case of emergency

We therefore ask the House to collaborate and coordinate with all levels of Government to fully fund an integrated road and public transit plan for the western suburbs of Brisbane, including the electorate of Ryan, with identified and funded solutions. Any identified solution must address both the two key requirements for emergency vehicle access during a major flood/fire event as well as reduced traffic congestion on Moggill Road for the rapidly expanding local population.

Key infrastructure projects and services must be delivered for the electorate of Ryan, spanning congestion, pedestrian and cyclist infrastructure, greater public transport services/integration into existing Rosewood train line, dedicated flood resilience funding and feasibility study for a traffic bridge crossing for the 21,000 residents of the Ryan electorate.
from two citizens (Petition No. EN4326)
COVID-19: Migration

I'm writing this Petition in the hope that there is some humanity left in the Australian Government. We have been victims of negligence by the Government or Due to Covid everyone are in Confused state. We stranded temporary visa holders had stuck overseas over 2 years. The country which we used to call our home has banned us from entering. We have witnessed our life savings being looted in Australia, lost jobs, all valuables, cars are discarded but anyway replacement visa would be great step to start again but the permanent resident option was long way from us due to covid and ban on us to enter Australia ruined everything. We have been a victim of such brutality for long period of time which has caused our mental health.

We therefore ask the House to respond to stranded temporary visa holders and other temporary visas give us an opportunity to extend our stay in Australia as permanent resident that would be also increase in economy by building tax , business options buying houses and pull us back to normal life. I with due respect seek you to make a way out for us and put an end to this ban and brutality. The House to arrange permanent resident option for stranded temporary visa holders who were brutally affected by covid and temporary visa holders who were paying their hard works to build Australia economy ,so let us give us option of permanent residents like new Zealand.
from two citizens (Petition No. EN4327)
Endometriosis

Over 830,000 women and those assigned female at birth have endometriosis. It is a disease that affects all aspects of the person's life. Those who suffer with Endometriosis have to spend, on average, $30,000 per year receiving treatment for this disease, including multiple surgeries a year, expensive pain relief, unpaid sick leave and tests not covered by medicare. This causes severe financial pressure on the diagnosed person and their family. On top of this, one in every six diagnosed person has reported losing their job due to endometriosis and one in every three have been passed over for a promotion. If endometriosis was to be recognised as a disability, this will drastically help families all over Australia. Individuals could apply for a disability support pension or for a NDIS package and relieve the financial pressure that endometriosis causes them. It would also create job stability as the person will be protected under the Disability Discrimination Act 1992.
We therefore ask the House to recognise Endometriosis as a disability.
from 12 citizens (Petition No. EN4330)
Higher Education Contribution Scheme
To investigate the if the purpose of the HECs scheme is legitimate considering the following points:
- It is not made clear to young adults how the scheme works (indexation, fees, upfront costs etc).
- It is reasonable foreseeable young adults will not look into fine print of the loan agreement.
- The approval process does not include face-to-face or over the phone consultations which would allow the Government to ensure the borrower understands the loan terms.
- The schemes debt repayments are unreasonable as lower income earners will never be able to pay off debt.
- Wages have not kept up with indexation meaning the charge of indexation is immoral.
- Unlike the private lending sector there are little to no checks in place when loan is approved.
- The loan is given with the assumption the borrower will become a high income earner.
- The price of higher education has increased substantially since 1989 although little changes have been made to the HECS scheme.
We therefore ask the House to consider the points provided and conduct a Government inquiry into the HECs Scheme and its purpose for Australians .
from 23 citizens (Petition No. EN4332)
Russia

Acts of international terrorism by the government of the Russian Federation (Russia), carried out by its armed forces and special services, have been consistently increasing over the past two decades. In 2014, Russia invaded Ukraine, annexed Crimea, instigated a war in the east of Ukraine, and committed acts of terrorism with civilian casualties: e.g., Malaysia Airlines flight MH17 was shot down by Russian-controlled forces using Russian-supplied military equipment, killing all 298 civilians aboard including 38 Australians. On 24 February 2022, Russia launched an unprovoked full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Over four months, Russia has engaged in deliberate and systematic bombing of civilian targets with over 2,500 missiles launched, which has so far resulted in over 4,670 civilian casualties including over 320 children, 45 million square meters of housing, and over 600 hospitals destroyed. This clearly demonstrates that the Russian government, its armed forces, and special services are both sponsors and perpetrators of international terrorism.

We therefore ask the House to immediately declare the Russian government, its armed forces, and special services as terrorist organisations. This will ensure that no Australian individual or entity can receive or make funds available, receive or make payments, sponsor, supply, or otherwise support these organisations and their members. This will greatly decrease, both in Australia and abroad, the threat of acts of terrorism controlled, ordered, or carried out by Russia, and prevent Australian entities from funding terrorism, genocide, and crimes against humanity.
from 2,753 citizens (Petition No. EN4333)
Temporary Graduate Visas

Temporary Graduate visa(485) holders have lived in Australia and supported the economy during the COVID-19 pandemic. Their support of the economy has taken many forms: work, study, paying rent, paying taxes, supporting local businesses and Australian online retailers, etc.
They never gave up and returned to their home countries. They stayed here in Australia and helped Australian economy by all means.
Eventhough due to the lockdowns the chances of getting desired jobs in respective fields has effected adversely, they didn't lose hope and stayed here in Australia helping the economy.
The people who lost time are getting replacement visas.
The people who stood by Australia during pandemic should also be given some more time to stay longer to achieve their goals.
Those who got 485 visa after 25 November 2022 are getting granted a stay of 3 year period
Those who got visa prior to 25 November 2021 were granted only 2 years of stay.

We therefore ask the House to increase the stay period to 3 years for Temporary Graduate Visa(485) holders who got 485 visa granted prior to 25 November 2022 and stayed in Australia during the pandemic and supported economy.
from one citizen (Petition No. EN4339)
Temporary Graduate Visas

Temporary Graduate visa(485) holders have lived in Australia and supported the economy during the COVID-19 pandemic. Their support of the economy has taken many forms: work, study, paying rent, paying taxes, supporting local businesses and Australian online retailers, etc. They never gave up and returned to their home countries during the pandemic. They stayed here in Australia and helped Australian economy by all means. Eventhough due to the lockdowns the chances of getting desired jobs in respective fields has effected adversely, they didn't lose hope and stayed here in Australia helping the economy. The people who lost time are getting replacement visas. The people who stood by Australia during pandemic should also be given some more time to stay longer to achieve their goals. Those who got 485 visa after 25 November 2021 are getting granted a stay of 3 year period Those who got visa prior to 25 November 2021 were granted only 2 years of stay.

We therefore ask the House to House to increase the stay period to 3 years for Temporary Graduate Visa(485) holders who got 485 visa granted prior to 25 November 2021 and stayed in Australia during the pandemic and supported economy.
from five citizens (Petition No. EN4340)
Type 2 Diabetes
Currently Type 2 diabetics who are insulin dependant can use Continuos Glucose Montiors [CGMS] to better manage their blood gluscose levels [BSL] and also prevent Hypoglycemia.
Subsidies currently apply for all Type 1 diabetics in Australia.
This should be extended to ALL Type 2 Diabetics that depend on insulin to regulate their BSL.
Full subsidy for those on health care card
Co-payment for those working fulll time
This would have the benefit of making it cheaper and simpler for Type 2 Diabtetics to manage their lives and budgets and more importantly lead to better health outcomes across the nation.
Costs of using the chepeast CGM available Freestyle Libre2 is $2500 per year.
We therefore ask the House to put forward a propsoal for CGM subsidies to include Type 2 diabetics to be able to access the following;
Full subsidy for CGM purchase for those on a Health Care Card
Co-Payment for CGM purchase for those not on a Health Care Card that work Full Time.
from four citizens (Petition No. EN4341)
Pensions and Benefits
Review and update the guidelines and requirements around child support services and payments.

Update structure and elements of how payments are made, circumstances of the payee, how the child receives the support payments, and elements surrounding the assessment of the childs living needs, requires a review.

We therefore ask the House to insist The Hon Bill Shorten MP, Minister for the National Disability Insurance Scheme, Minister for Government Services to review this department and update it's standards and guidelines to create a fair and sustainable future for our children, and the single parents supporting them.
from six citizens (Petition No. EN4342)
Environment

We are being sprayed with chemicals from jets by geo-engineering this is harming the environment by modifying the weather, This also effects our food that we grow and health. No one in the government or commercial media will talk about this. We need this to be acted on NOW as you are effecting the health of every Australian and using it to control the weather patterns. We see it with our own eyes what you are spraying into our airspace
We therefore ask the House to investigate why this is happening and why are we being sprayed. AND MAKE IT STOP
from 30 citizens (Petition No. EN4343)
Marriage

The marriage law should be changed to allow people in consensual adult incest oriented (CIAO) relationships to marry. The Royal Commission on Human Relationships in the 1970s in its final recommendations said the incest law should be repealed and federal law in Australia does not now criminalize incestuous relationships. Laws that prevented same-sex marriage were discriminatory, but so are laws preventing CIAO marriage. Laws and policies that criminalize sexuality and reproduction amount to a violation of human rights and deny individuals their complete bodily autonomy. They not only prevent individuals from determining how they use their bodies as an expression of love or sexual fulfilment in their private lives but also stop them from expressing their personal identity and realizing their individual human potential and ability to make decisions. Human rights violations that affect bodily autonomy are a direct assault on human dignity. Full marriage equality requires that CIAO people can marry legally, just as same-sex couples can. Everyone loses when states criminalize consensual sexual and reproductive behaviour or the expression of sexual and gender identities.
We therefore ask the House to change the marriage law to allow (CIAO) people in adult consensual incest oriented relationships to marry legally.
from two citizens (Petition No. EN4345)
Consumer Rights: Ticketed Events

Over many years the company Viagogo has fraudulently represented itself and has scammed many unexpected ticket purchasers, leaving a trail of stress, despair and financial loss. From selling invalid tickets, child tickets as adult tickets, multiple copies of the same single ticket to different customers, over priced tickets or just not supplying the ticket at all and denying a refund to the customer, this company falsely represents itself as an authorised ticket holder—It is a scam site. They have scammed money off over 3000 consumers and counting . So much that there are multiple Facebook sites such as Victims of Viagogo, for the victims to assist each other—I would like to petition that the website and the company are banned from trading in Australia and that their website be taken down to prevent further consumer financial loss and heartache.

We therefore ask the House to assist in having the website and the company Viagogo banned from trading in Australia and that their website be taken down to prevent further consumer financial loss and heartache.
from eight citizens (Petition No. EN4350)
National Security
Australia Border Force put the sea cargos on hold for indefinite time providing no timeframe or reason, no compensation for the damage or storage caused by the delay.

We therefore ask the House to 1. Set a timeframe for ABF to processing and releasing cargos. 2. If the cargos can't be released on time, explanations need to be provided. 3. ABF needs to be responsible or partially responsible for the damage caused by the delay.
from five citizens (Petition No. EN4352)
Veterans

VEA s17 obliges the Secretary of the Department of Veterans Affairs to cause an investigation into claims for an increase in pensions (claim), or applications for pensions (application), and VEA s19 requires the Repatriation Commission to determine these same claims or applications…

These investigations and determinations are currently undertaken by the same person, and although this may provide for administrative convenience, it raises a real and genuine concern in relation to apprehended bias, as exemplified in Isbester v Knox City Council [2015] HCA 20…
We the undersigned believe any process which raises even the most remote concern of apprehended bias to be improper and unacceptable.

We therefore ask the House to cause such change to the legislation, as to result in separate persons undertaking these s17 investigations and s19 determinations. And by doing so reinstall a semblance of reasonableness, sensibility and natural justice in the VEA claim and application processes, which will in turn will infuse confidence with those suffeing this proceedural injustice, and lay to rest concerns of apprehended bias.
from nine citizens (Petition No. EN4353)
Human Rights: Kashmir

This petition is about an alarming human rights situation and humanitarian crisis in Indian Illegally Occupied Jammu and Kashmir (IIOJK). The people of Jammu and Kashmir have been under a military siege since 5 August 2019 when India, illegally and unilaterally revoked the constitutional autonomy of IIOJK. The human rights violations is documented by human rights organizations, international media and UN Office of the High Commissioner on Human Rights (OHCHR).
We therefore ask the House to
• publicly raise the issue of human rights violations with the Indian leadership.
• Call on India to reverse the illegal actions of 5 August 2019 and so-called delimitation of IIOJK.

• Remind India to refrain from bringing any changes in the occupied territory in contravention to international law, the Geneva Conventions, and India's own obligations under the relevant UN Security Council resolutions.
• Compel and counsel India to halt its human rights abuses against the people of IIOJK.
• India should be held accountable for draconian laws like AFSPA, PSA, and others and called to repeal such laws in IIOJK.

• Accept the OHCHR's Reports and recommendations on Jammu and Kashmir, agreeing on the establishment of UN-supervised Commission of Inquiry to comprehensively investigate all the charges of human rights violations.
• Immediately release all Kashmiri political leaders, social activists, rights defenders, journalists, teenagers, and others detained under PSA or false criminal charges.
• Implement, without further delay, relevant UN resolutions to allow people of Jammu & Kashmir to exercise their will through a free and fair plebiscite under UN auspices.
from three citizens (Petition No. EN4356)
Foreign Investment

Non Australian citizens should not be allowed to own any percentage of rural agricultural land, residential, commercial or industrial property within Australia. The total amount of land in Australia with foreign ownership is 130,965,852 million acres or 530,000 square kilometres. This land mass is vastly greater then Spain, Japan, Germany, Italy, England, South Korea and a further 175 Countries and Territories. Livestock remains the dominant use for foreign-owned agricultural land. The Food prices, particularly meat has and will continue to increase out of control as we loose control and ownership of our food producing land. Ownership entitles these foreigners to sell, transport what they grow and produce on this land to overseas interests, leaving Australia with less food supply and therefore higher food prices. Preventing foreign ownership of our rural agricultural land will secure our future food security for our own citizens. Preventing foreign ownership of our residential properties helps keep the domestic residential property market affordable for our countries own citizens by way of less demand and competition. There are many other countries and territories throughout the world whereby foreigners cannot own land. This is at the forefront of national importance for food security and price control of land for current and future Australian citizens.

We therefore ask the House to draft a bill for debate to pass a National law that no non-Australian citizen can own any percentage of rural agricultural land, residential, industrial or commercial property within Australia.
from 38 citizens (Petition No. EN4359)
Member for Cook
Mr Morrison's grandfather was a New Zealand citizen living in Sydney when his mother was born.
In 1948 New Zealand changed their citizenship law so that male children born overseas to New Zealand citizens would get citizenship by decent.

Female children were not mentioned in the law and according to legal authorities in New Zealand those female children born overseas to New Zealand citizens would get full New Zealand citizenship and would pass on New Zealand citizenship to their own children.

Mr Morrison has New Zealand citizenship in the same way as Senator Ludlam had and Mr Joyce had. Both of those lost the right to be in parliament in the High Court because of their New Zealand citizenship.

Mr Morrison was told of his New Zealand citizenship in December 2019 via a petition to parliament so had signed a false declaration to nominate for election in 2022. Mr Porter answered that petition in 2019 by referring to the Court of Disputed returns instead of to the matter of dual citizenship. He also mentioned the members statement in which Mr Morrison did not mention he was a New Zealand citizen.
Petitions in a previous parliament are not relevant in that this matter can only relate to the 47th parliament.

We therefore ask the House to put Mr Morrison to the High Court to determine if he can be removed from parliament for being a citizen of New Zealand and to consider pressing criminal charges for signing a false declaration to nominate.
from 36 citizens (Petition No. EN4361)
Aviation Industry: Consumer Protection

Australians are being abused by our airlines. Strong laws need to pass to ensure airlines look after passengers when things go wrong. Let's follow the European Unions lead and hold airlines in Australia accountable and give the citizens the protections they deserve
We therefore ask the House to look at the European unions laws and bring the same safe guards here for Australian travellers.
from 179 citizens (Petition No. EN4362)
Temporary Graduate Visas
My petition is regarding the recent Temporary graduate visa (Subclass 485) Replacement Stream effective from 1st July 2022.

According to the eligibility criteria of this visa, an individual is eligible to apply for this 485 visa if they were out of Australia, even for a 'Single Day' between 1 February 2020 to 15 December 2021.

There are many 485 onshore visa holders who did not leave Australia during this pandemic and lost a significant time of their visa durations due to COVID-19 restrictions and lockdowns. Also, there were many onshore visa holders who were not able to find relevant employment for the postgraduate qualification due to the economic impact of COVID-19.

Further, these visa holders largely contributed to the Australian economy during the pandemic time working under difficult lockdown conditions. Unfortunately, these onshore visa holders are not eligible to apply for this new 485 replacement stream.

Also, the visa holders who were granted 485 Post Study Work Visa after the COVID-19 in 2020 are not eligible to get the new 3 years visa duration as a result of completing the Master of Coursework qualification.
We therefore ask the House to kindly consider this issue and provide the opportunity for the onshore visa holders to apply for the Replacement Stream. Thank You!
from three citizens (Petition No. EN4366)
Parliament
Standing order 38 has an anachronistic element requiring Christian prayers be read by the Speaker on taking the chair at the start of each sitting.
We therefore ask the House to remove that part of Section 38 requiring Christian prayers be read.
from 29 citizens (Petition No. EN4367)
Foot-and-Mouth Disease
To avoid a catastrophic end to Australia's Agriculture industry.

We therefore ask the House to seriously look & consider the catastrophic outcomes should FMD enter Australia & please 🙏 do what's best for all Australians & enforce stricter security measures to ensure a clean & safe Pest & Disease free Agriculture industry .
from two citizens (Petition No. EN4368)
Australian National Flag

We need to change our Australian and afterwards our State flags as it still represents a former colony of the UK with the Union Jack and doesn't represent a modern Australia that rules itself with our own very unique culture that I can safely say most of us are very proud of.

We therefore ask the House to change the design of our National Flag and then afterwards our State flags through a national wide popular vote that we take as serious as our national election. In order to breakaway from the UK, this is a necessary step to completely show our own culture and not through a former colonial symbol (The Union Jack). We need something new that represents Australia today not what we were 121 years ago.It's been long enough, it's time to change (Just think of Canada as a good example).
from six citizens (Petition No. EN4369)
Medicare

We would like the government to increase Medicare rebate from $39.10 for GPS should be increased to at least $60 or $80 and private organisations should be capped because their costs are going up without very difference in the service.
We therefore ask the House to increase the rate on medicare rebate so that more GPS won't have to charge out of pocket expenses and put a cap on private medicare companies to pay for the bulk billing
from nine citizens (Petition No. EN4373)
New South Wales: Flood Mitigation
Thousands of people lives and properties are being severely being damaged by major floods constantly. Enough is enough.

We therefore ask the House to commission to have a review and reach a plan to mitigate major floods in the NSW area. The Warragamba dam was designed to not be a flood mitigation system, however thousands of residents are constantly being affected by floods which is partly contributed by the Warragamba dam. We urge the Government and Water authority to reach a long term plan. Ie, build a secondarily capture dam after the Warragamba dam, plus or build a pipe to run our precious water to those areas of NSW who are prone to droughts from the Warragamba Dam. Please capture the water, instead of allowing the water to over spill Warragamba dam and cause major damage to lives and properties. Our properties and lives are in your hands dear (Government and NSW water authority).
from 811 citizens (Petition No. EN4377)
National Security

Australia has leased key utilities and property to overseas interests, who might not have Australia's best interests at heart. We propose the House of Representatives' shorten all 99 year lease agreements to overseas interests, to 18 years, with the ability to extend by another 9 years. This way there is still an attraction for overseas investors, while leases can be controlled and monitored, and if necessary made null and void if there are any perceived threats to Australian sovereignty, or if Australia needs to resume their own utility and property interests.

We therefore ask the House to reduce the timeframe of all 99 year leases approved by States or Territories with Overseas Owned Interests, to a period of 18 years, with the ability to extend another 9 years, in the interest of Australia's National Security.
from 17 citizens (Petition No. EN4379)
Veterans

Under the Repatriation Act 1920 there was provision for the review instrument to put questions of law to a federal court in a manner that largely replicates AAT s45, this provision was not carried forward to the VEA…

The Minister in his response to Parliamentary Petition EN1174 stated, "It is widely acknowledged the VEA is unnecessarily complex, particularly in relation to the review provisions which were addressed by Justice Logan in Shafran. This complexity adds to differences in understanding, and at times will require judicial guidance. The fact that these issues required consideration by the Federal Court highlights the legislation could be clearer in this area"…

An AATs45 type process introduced at VEA s137, would provide a vehicle whereby Veterans or the Secretary DVA themselves, could resolve any complex issues, without the hostilities, costs and legal complications ordinarily associates with Federal Court actions
We therefore ask the House to introduce an amendment to the VEA which would result in the introduction of an AATs45 type process into the VEA.
from two citizens (Petition No. EN4381)
Veterans

The Repatriation Medical Authority have defined "Clinical Onset" as to mean "the first time the veteran noticed anything to do with the disease. Clinical onset is not when it's diagnosed, not when the first laboratory test or X-ray is done. Clinical onset in its ordinary English usage means the first time the patient notices anything to do with the actual disease"…

Recently claims and applications under the Military Rehabilitation and Compensation Act 2004 and Veterans Entitlement Act 1996 have been determined using a different definition, noticeably when the condition is first recorded and diagnosed…
Parliament has legislated a number of definitions associated with the functions of the RMA and we the undersigned request it do the same regarding "Clinical Onset".

We therefore ask the House to legislate the meaning or definition of "clinical onset" strictly as per the RMA definition, which will remove the ambiguity which is causing improper determinations to be made.
from three citizens (Petition No. EN4382)
Pharmaceutical Benefits Scheme

The Federal Parliament legalised the use of medicinal cannabis products across Australia in February 2016, but access to treatment is still severely limited due to cost, with patients reporting average monthly costs in excess of $300, or approximately $10 per day. Not only is this a barrier to much-needed relief for many Australians, but it also encourages an illicit trade in home-grown cannabis.
We therefore ask the House to expedite the listing of TGA-approved cannabis products on the PBS as a matter of urgency.
from 6,687 citizens (Petition No. EN4383)
Dental Health

Dental is a very vital part of our overall health, but unfortunately it often gets overlooked when it comes to the price of the services required to maintain healthy teeth and gums. Poor dental hygiene can lead to a range of oral related problems, which if left untreated can lead to very severe health problems (heart disease, stroke, cancers of the mouth etc). Recent studies have shown that more than 50% of Australians avoid going to the dentist, and that number will continue to rise. There is no shortage of Australians going to their GP or the emergency room, when needed, so why are we so reluctant to get our annual dental check-ups and additional oral surgeries? It's plain and simple, because of the price. With house, gas, food, and education fees continuously on the rise, at least HALF of Australians cannot afford this basic human need.

We therefore ask the House to lower the fees of general dental and dental procedures. We need to start treating dental health as urgently as we treat all other aspects of a human being's health, and that change starts with lowering the cost.
from 29 citizens (Petition No. EN4385)
Nuclear Energy
Climate change to reduce coal and gas needs a mix of actions.
As existing coal power is retired a small modular reactor can be put on site.
A nuclear waste report already done, have a nuclear agency.
Nuclear is better on cost, waste and build time.
We therefore ask the House to remove nuclear ban.
from 44 citizens (Petition No. EN4387)
Youth Justice

Australia has one of the lowest ages of criminal responsibility in the world. The age of criminal responsibility in all states and self-governing territories in Australia is 10, well below the age a child is deemed capable of having committed a criminal offence. Neurologically, the human brain does not reach full adult functionality until the age of 25. Children are thus not developmentally capable of committing crimes, and also not capable of being formally diagnosed with major criminal psychiatric disorders under the age of 18. The Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court also excludes jurisdiction of criminality for persons under the age of 18. Over 600 children under the age of 14 are locked up in Australian prisons each year, including in adult prisons where they are detained, and abused, in cells alongside adult violent offenders. This is currently recognized as a human rights violation internationally, and in contravention of Australia's ratification of the United Nations Charter of Human Rights, and Rights of the Child as a member state with international obligations for conduct. These current laws disproportionately adversely impact Aboriginal Australians and Torres Strait Islander people, and also socioeconomically disadvantaged communities—the poor. This legislation is cruel, and does not reflect democratic values of the 21st Century.

We therefore ask the House to review this legislation with urgency, to raise the minimum age of Criminal Responsibility to 14, until alternative strategies can be implemented to raise the age of Full Criminal Responsibility to 18.
from 10 citizens (Petition No. EN4390)
Motorsport

Calling on the Commonwealth Government to establish and implement a National Motorsport Strategy and increase funding for participation programs and new incentives for junior Motorsport categories including women and girls.
We therefore ask the House to ask the Commonwealth Minister for Sport to outline a new National Motorsport Strategy.
from eight citizens (Petition No. EN4392)
National Disability Insurance Scheme
The need for a fair NDIS by having a chairman with a disability. This will give people with disabilities a representative that understands what it is like to live with a lifelong disability.
We therefore ask the House to appoint an appropriate member to chair the NDIS that can be unbiased and create ongoing reform to a broken system.
from nine citizens (Petition No. EN4393)

subdebateinfo.title: Health Care: Drug and Alcohol Services

p.span: Health Care: Drug and Alcohol Services

Murray Mallee General Practice Network Inc (MMGPN) was advised in March 2022, after a long process, that a further two years of funding for our drug and alcohol program would be provided from July 2022. However, with the change in government, this has not occurred—we have been advised that grant agreements will only be issued in October 2022 due to bureaucratic processes. The Department of Health has informed us that unless we have an underspend, we should cease services. This is despite the Murray Mallee region's significant drug and alcohol use with limited services. MMGPN is the primary and trusted provider for people in the area. This process and delay further marginalises vulnerable people in our region, decreases help-seeking and overall costs the government more in increased disability, unemployment, criminal justice costs, and poor outcomes for children and young people.

MMGPN engaged in a lengthy, evidence-based process to secure ongoing funding; therefore, these delays are unjustified and detrimental to our community. This is the exact opposite of what a Labor government is meant to stand for—our most vulnerable people and providing primary health care as a fundamental human right.

We therefore ask the House to urgently ensure that the Department of Health issues a contract and funds by the end of August for all people in the Murray Mallee region to have access to drug and alcohol services or alternatively provide interim funds until grant agreements are finalised
from one citizen (Petition No. EN4399)
Skilled Migration Program
Revisit and pass the "New Skilled Regional Visas (Consequential Amendments) Bill 2019" access to social security payments and government services on the same terms as permanent visa holders.
This bill will be life altering for many families who are struggling on these visas due to lack of Australian support especially after the pandemic.

They have agreed to these 491/482 visas with full time work as a must and medium salary caps to make PR after 3 years, yet there Social and humanitarian rights have seemed to be brushed away for no good reason?

With our fresh and intelligent supporting government, we feel strongly that this bill be revisited to boost mental health, general well being and economic growth throughout regional Australia for people who genuinely want to be here and create happy comfortable Australian family lives.

We therefore ask the House to prioritize a review of the New Skilled Regional Visas (Consequential Amendments) Bill 2019, That amends seven Acts to provide that holders of these provisional skilled regional visas will have the same access to welfare payments and government services as permanent visa holders where eligible.
from 12 citizens (Petition No. EN4400)
Aged Care

Carers for the elderly give up their lives to look after their LOs so they don't have to go into a nursing home. The Goverment states, they want the elderly to stay in their homes as long as possible. At the moment carers are paid very little and with not much room to earn any extra money without penalties from the Government. Carers are saving taxpayers thousands of dollars but to what expense to their mental and physical health? Loss of income, self esteem and time out of their lives, sometimes never to get this time back to catch up with monies lost. It's not about the money. It's about the dignity. We have to support our carers with more funding, free mental healthcounseling and the freedom to take a job without tax penalties. It's time to support our carers, the people that give up their lives to look after their elderly. Their job is 24/7 washing, cleaning, cooking, repetitive conversations, drs appointments, health issues,

org. medicines, trying to navigate the age care system and they ask for little in return. The elderly deserve the dignity to stay in their homes and be cared for by their loved ones. Carers need more help.
We therefore ask the House to pass a legislation for more funding to carers, more mental and physical help for carers and allow carers to take jobs without penalties.
from 84 citizens (Petition No. EN4403)
Environment

Geoengineering is the climate elephant in the skies above our heads. Weather modification programs are causing irreversible damage to all life on earth. Land, air and marine life are being devastated by air dispersed toxic chemicals such as barium, aluminium and silver iodide into our skies via aircraft to name one method. Traces of such chemicals have been found in high altitude air, soil and marine test samples, the proof has been documented by U.S conservationist Dane Wigington amongst many others. It is impossible to control the weather of one geographical area without creating problems in another, it's the old analogy of robbing Peter to pay Paul. Many methods have been patented for Geoengineering, any used are contributing to unprecedented climate change and this is fact! It is well documented that the methods used are responsible for extreme weather patterns causing extreme flooding, catastrophic drought and wildfires! Geoengineering is causing a rapid acceleration of climate destruction, it's destroying many ecosystems. The chemicals used in air spraying programs can be linked to many health issues including cardiovascular and neurological diseases in humans.
Geoengineering is a direct assault to our health and our environment. Geoengineering must be stopped to preserve all forms of life and climate on earth!

We therefore ask the House to represent all Australians whom are concerned for their health, their families health, the well being of all life, ecosystems and climate on earth. We demand that all methods of toxic geoengineering programs be stopped in Australia!
from 37 citizens (Petition No. EN4406)
Parliamentary Standards

Several times the LNP brought up the idea of drug and alcohol testing the unemployed. I lodged a petition asking that parliamentarians be drug and alcohol tested daily while in Canberra and randomly when in their electorates. Senator McGrath, while assistant to Prime Minister Turnbull, answered that petition by saying it wasn't up to voters to tell MPs what to do.

Many major companies drug and alcohol test all staff but in particular their senior big money earning peoples. MPs earn about a quarter of a million dollars a year as a basic amount. That sort of money would indicate they should be sober while at work in parliament and while at work in their electorates. Drug testing would be almost a necessity when the water testing that used to be done in Canberra is taken into consideration. The outflows from parliament used to be some of the worst in the country for cocaine residue.
Public servants working in Parliament House can be drug and alcohol tested under their work contracts.
We therefore ask the House to bring in drug and alcohol testing for MPs and their political staff and assistants.
from 52 citizens (Petition No. EN4408)

subdebateinfo.title: Rural and Regional Health Services: Pharmacy Services

p.span: Rural and Regional Health Services: Pharmacy Services

Rural LAP provides Locum Pharmacists for Pharmacies when the owner (applicant for the service) is a registered Pharmacist. There have been many instances where a Rural Pharmacy requires a Pharmacist Locum to stay open, but a person who does not hold a pharmacist registration has needed to apply for this service, and been rejected.

We therefore ask the House to extend the Eligibility Criteria to include extenuating circumstances, where the owner of a pharmacy, who does not hold a professional registration is able to access Rural LAP. This would enable the Pharmacy to remain open and continue to provide Rural communities access to basic healthcare, which would otherwise be at a disadvantage if the Pharmacy was closed.
from five citizens (Petition No. EN4410)
Illicit Drugs: Cannabis
Cannabis was made illegal in Australia. Since then the Cannabis trade has grown and Prohibition of Cannabis is no longer the best or safest method of controlling Cannabis Consumption.

Many Young people end up with a Criminal History for choosing to consume a drug, that is less Harmful then Alcohol and Medically Prescribed in Australia. It is Hypocracy to allow some people to have a Drug for Medical Purposes and even Export Cannabis Grown here in Australia to places like Germany and such countries for Medical use and then throw the youth of Australia into Jail for having a "Joint" or a "bong" because it is a "Dangerous Drug"
One would argue that these Young Australian Adults had made a Guenuine Decision to use a less Harmful Drug that has less Harmful Side Affects to the Depressant Drug namely Alcohol.

Cannabis is a Drug for relaxation and one associated with Laughter. The world needs more laughter these days and it seems absurd to want to outlaw a drug that may promote laughter and happiness, while keeping your society depressed by a depressant.
Legalising Cannabis for recreational purposes will greatly reduce the problems and provide more tax.
We therefore ask the House to Legalise Cannabis for Personal use and create a Regulatory system for Sale Consumption in Public, trade of Cannabis, Growing Privately and Commercially
from 5,169 citizens (Petition No. EN4411)

subdebateinfo.title: Visual Arts Industry: Film and Television

p.span: Visual Arts Industry: Film and Television

I am a Film and TV student and am looking into moving overseas to work as we have a small industry here that does not support enough of the talent we have in Australia. Listening to Lecturers, moving would be the best for any of us in this industry
We therefore ask the House to Help our TV and Film Industry.
People e.g. actors, and film crew here in Australia are finding that we will get more out of moving overseas with our careers.

In the 80's Australia had the start of a booming industry, with a 100%-150% incentive to put into Australian films for investors. That brought us many different movies and shows that would be viewed around the world; Mad Max, Crocodile Dundee, Gallipoli, The Adventures of Priscilla Queen of the Desert etc. Adding to our economy. Now in 2022 we have a very small industry that is barely making it out of Australia. Most our talent, actors, and film crew are leaving for overseas.

We need to keep our talent here and make our own movies and shows that will put back into our economy. The talent and creativity we have here could rival some of the bigger countries but get next to no support.
We are not asking for the same percentage as before, but we are asking for more support for an industry struggling to survive.
from 16 citizens (Petition No. EN4414)
Medicare
To ensure Australian society's most vulnerable retain their right to affordable medical care
We therefore ask the House to ensure that Bulk Billing is restored and maintained to ensure our most vulnerable members of society have access to appropriate medical care and medication
from 48 citizens (Petition No. EN4416)
Member for Cook

Aware of reports that the Member for Cook took on Ministerial Roles without such roles being published in the Administrative Arrangements Orders and without informing the Speaker or the House, and noting that such conduct or arrangement may constitute a contempt of the House and that such conduct if true or entrenched would threaten to undermine the accountability of the executive to the House
We therefore ask the House to refer the aforementioned alleged conduct of the Member for Cook to the Privileges Committee for Investigation and report.
from 12 citizens (Petition No. EN4417)
Medicare
Significant and rising out of pocket costs for patient health care in general practice is forcing severe financial burden on patients and placing health care out of reach for many patients.
This is placing severe stress on the public health hospital system through Emergency Department attendances and decompensation in chronic diseases leading to increased hospitalisations.

Immediate action is required to bring patient medicare rebates in line with real costs incurred by them when seeing a GP and to ensure the sustainability of general practice and future GP workforce stability.

We therefore ask the House to consider immediate adjustment in consultation based medicare items (item 3, 23, 36, 44 and out of office/home and residential care consultations) for general practice to be increased with retrospective adjustment (for pre-historic inflation) to reflect the current AMA recommended cost for a patient to see a general practitioner.
from 71 citizens (Petition No. EN4418)
Migration

Australia is a multicultural country where many of its Citizens and Permanent Residents migrated from overseas. Thousands of these Australians including skilled migrants have family circumstances from single working mothers, young children needing extra familial care, to mental health issues where they need their parents from overseas supporting them here. A lot of skilled migrant Australians need their parents here to help looking after their young children so that they can continue to work, contributing to Australian economy. But visa application backlog has caused further misery and currently the Immigration is not considering compelling and compassionate circumstances in the processing of family visas. The Immigration is keeping Australian families separated instead of united to support each other and staying safe. Contributory Parent Visa 143 processing time has become 6 years to unknown from previously 12 months. Visa condition of No Further Stay (NFS) often imposed on family visas and no reason is compelling enough to get a NFS Waiver. Hundreds of letters been sent to different Ministers. Government claimed to support mental health but no help given until a public media was involved. Government has the capacity to help refugees but why can't it help its own people as well?

We therefore ask the House to help its own people of Australia, reduce visa application backlog, increase parent visa capacity, consider compelling and compassionate circumstances in the processing of family visas including the NFS waiver applications, especially those in need to keep Australian families safely together, reduce mental health issues.
from 2,081 citizens (Petition No. EN4419)
Dementia
Providing Australia and Australians with necessary health care and educating them through awareness of disease through greater transparency.

We therefore ask the House to initiate plasma exchange clinics to provide thousands of Australians with life saving therapy and provide research in combating the second biggest killer in our health system. The proposal would create new study and open doors for many Australians whom are currently living with or at risk of on set dementia in Australia. I have recently lost a relative whom suffered autoimmune dementia who was written off by the health system and was locked away in an aged care demtia ward. Politicians in this country are well aware of the shameful past of treatment of the elderly and frail in this country in agedcare dementia units or lock down facilities. They are restrained physically and pharmaceuticaly which often leads to their deaths. There is need for these types of clinics as dementia is a number 1 killer in public health. They can change the lives of 1000s of Australians. The clinics will educate and create more transparency about disease. This inititve has to be a better option than the current status quoe of pharmaceutical concealment and a poor quality of living standards for patient's whom are pharmaceuticaly and physically restrained in care which often leads to their deaths.
from four citizens (Petition No. EN4420)
Food Labelling

It has come to my attention that certain food labels don't clearly state the ingredients of what is inside the product. It is hard for consumers to research every single product to find out what animal products are contained in packaged food labels. It would bring clarity to consumers if producers were required to make clear on all packaging if it is not suitable for vegeterians/vegans. Using numbers to convey information in food labels is not clear to consumers what is inside the food that they eat.

We therefore ask the House to put forward laws that require businesses/manufacturers to write/label packaged food as either suitable or not suitable for vegetarian/vegans and for producers to clearly list the animal products that may be present.
from 11 citizens (Petition No. EN4423)
Australian Constitution
To acknowledge all Indigenous and Torres Strait Islanders as our First Nation peoples.
To include Indigenous and Torres Strait Islanders' history.
To delete any racist laws.

We therefore ask the House to create a referendum to change the Constitution to acknowledge all Indigenous and Torres Strait Islanders as the First Nation peoples, and to remove racist laws from the Constitution immediately.
from 23 citizens (Petition No. EN4425)
Parliamentary Standards

Transparency and accountability are of the utmost importance for the proper functioning of democracy in this country. Critical to this accountability is the requirement for this House to know who has been appointed a Minister of State.

We therefore ask the House to censure any members now known to have kept secret from this House their appointment as a Minister. Such behaviour is intolerable in a parliamentary democracy such as ours.
from 20 citizens (Petition No. EN4426)
Child Care

Child care centres are full. Cost of living is high. 2 Parents have to work to survive. Grandparents are looking after their Grandkids. It's time Grandparents received a payment for becoming Child Care workers. Assistance for Granparents to help cover the costs of Child Care. It's a lot for Grandparents. They have raised their kids. Why should they spend their retirement raising their Grandkids? Because they do, to help their kids out. Well enough is enough. It's time to have a Child Care Subsidy for Grandparents. Allow Grandparents to be paid for giving up their retirement time. We pay for child care if we can get into one. Just because they are Grandparents, doesn't mean it should be a free ride. Our parents have worked their entire lives, paid taxes, now their free time is given to help care for kids again. I appreciate my parents caring for my kids. If it wasn't for them, I couldn't work and pay my mortgage or bills. Help me help your parents. It's time to give back to Grandparents. Sign if you're with me!

We therefore ask the House to include a Child Care Subsidy Payment for Grandparents who care for their Grandkids so the Parents can work. Allow Grandparents to be paid like a Child Care Center. Wait lists for Child Care right now is astronomical. Our only option is Grandparents caring. Help pay for the care.
from 29 citizens (Petition No. EN4430)
Member for Cook
The core reason for this petition is that Scott Morrissons actions were undemocratic and against our core principles

This is because he secretly appointed himself into these roles, ensuring that their was little scrutiny or press coverage. Therefore, fundamentally disrespecting Australians right to be informed on who controls and has power to take actions on certain issues in their country.
We therefore ask the House to condemn Scott Morrison for these actions and create a parliamentary committee to investigate them
from 37 citizens (Petition No. EN4432)
Skilled Migration Program

491 visa has been in existence since past 3 years and a lot of immigrants have taken the opportunity to migrate to regional Australia and have helped the economy which has been the purpose of visa. However, not being treated as a domestic student, income mandate as well as missing out on certain social security has undermined the core population helping Australian regional areas prosperity. Further, the limitation of the visa has also have a detrimental effect on the people who would like to buy a house and settle in regional areas as there are only a couple of bank who would carter 491 visa holder as the visa holders are not permanent resident. Hence, we would request the government for an easier 191 pathway as well as better 491 programs which would enable more migrants to embrace 491 and grow regional economy. It seems extremely unfair and unjust when skilled migrant worker who would like to skill up and contributed more to regional Australia are felt being punished for taking 491 visas and helping regional Australia grow.
We therefore ask the House to discuss on the possibilities of accommodating more facilities to 491 visa holders and help them grow regional Australia.
from 666 citizens (Petition No. EN4433)
Gender Dysphoria

Transgender ideology is infiltrating culture, school curriculum, media, social media and marketing. Despite the lack of scientific basis, an unquestioning affirmation approach to treat gender dysphoria is used by gender clinics and being adopted into law by some Australian States. Children and young people experiencing gender confusion receive risky medical treatment resulting in dire life-long health repercussions. Minors are being prescribed puberty blocker hormones as a precursor to sex change surgery. Australian children, too young to get a tattoo, have had healthy body parts amputated despite eminent medical professionals calling for psychological issues to be addressed before giving unproven treatments involving hormones and surgery.
Young Australians are emerging who regret treatments which have left them scarred and infertile for the remainder of their lives. There is a growing de-transitioner movement.

Following the closure of the UK Tavistock gender, around 1,000 families plan legal action over gross negligence, rushing teenagers into irreversible, life-altering decisions including taking life-changing puberty blocking drugs. Countries such as Sweden, Finland, France and UK are reviewing, re-evaluating, stopping, or advising caution on the treatment of gender dysphoria in children and adolescents.
It is our belief that young people are inadequately educated, or completely unaware, about the risks when they initiate the process of transitioning.

We therefore ask the House to conduct a formal, independent, Parliamentary inquiry to investigate what should be the foundation of medical best practice in treating gender confusion in children and young adults.
from 28,265 citizens (Petition No. EN4434)
Sport: Australian Football League

AFLW is a growing and valued sport. However in relation to facilities it is seen to be undervalued. To support cultural change, this petition is looking to support the development of female/gender neutral changerooms, clubspaces and toilets at all AFLW playing grounds and venues.
By providing appropriately located facilities this will support change toward equality for all our AFL players and umpires, now and into the future to support our mighty Australian game.
If you have further enquires please contact aflimprovement@outlook.com

We therefore ask the House to provide funds to help support this change in big AFL and AFLW played venues. As well as local councils to create this around the local football clubs as they are helping to shape the upcoming AFL and AFLW players.
from five citizens (Petition No. EN4440)
Baw Baw Frog

The Baw Baw frog is a critically endangered animal that is under threat due to the infections of the chyrid fungus. More signatures of this petition will grow more awareness for the Baw Baw frogs and we also want the government to help the Baw Baw frogs as they can do more research and have more awareness to this critically endangered species.
We therefore ask the House to do more research on the Chyrid fungus killing the baw baw frogs.
from 40 citizens (Petition No. EN4441)
Superannuation

Current superannuation laws do not allow rental properties being bought under a loan through Self Managed Superannuation Funds to make capital improvements on these properties. This means that they are not allowed to install solar power systems or other energy efficiency improvements on these properties. These should be allowed under the superannuation laws which would help attain government targets on carbon emission reduction and also reduce electricity costs for renters.

We therefore ask the House to amend the Self Managed Superannuation Fund laws to allow at the installation of energy efficiency capital improvements (such as solar power systems or insulation) in rental properties being purchased via a loan under the SMSF.
from 13 citizens (Petition No. EN4442)
Australian National Anthem
The current National Anthem is old, outdated and doesn't reflect the current progressiveness that current day Australia is trying to achieve.
We therefore ask the House to change the National Anthem to something more Australians see as a representation of our country to songs like 'I Am You Are We Are Australian'.
from 40 citizens (Petition No. EN4444)
Centrelink

The closure of the Benalla Centrelink Office has disadvantaged many residents of this regional community who rely on Services Australia income payments, services, and support. This decision unfairly impacts many older people receiving the pension, unemployed workers, people with a disability, veterans and families receiving child support. It also undermines the provision of Medicare services. The new agency digital 'self-service' is a very poor substitute for a properly funded person service.

We therefore ask the House to direct the responsible Minister for Government Services to review this decision and to re-open the Benalla Centrelink Office as a matter of urgency. We also support a review of similar decisions impacting other communities across Australia.
from 2,180 citizens (Petition No. PN0541)
Territory Rights: Voluntary Assisted Dying

The Victorian, Western Australia, Tasmanian, South Australian and Queensland State parliaments have changed their laws to allow their citizens to obtain a legally assisted death. The New South Wales parliament is poised to make similar changed. The 1997 Euthanasia Laws Act that prevents the territories from making laws on euthanasia to allow their citizens to obtain a legally assisted death is now inconsistent with the law in the majority of sates and so is unjust and inequitable in dying Australians living in the territories access to the same legal right to a peaceful death. It therefore should be repealed.
We ask the House to repeal the 1997 Euthanasia laws Act as soon as possible.
from 151 citizens (Petition No. PN0542)
Banking and Financial Services

The Royal Commission into Banking was called in 2017 because of widespread evidence of systematic misconduct by major banks in Australia.
